page.title: 02INTERVIEW WITH MRS HELLIER.
page.content: {by CHLOE TOAL age10,VICTORIA WAIN {age10,KAREN PIEROTTI age10.}The house Mrs.Hellier lives in,{3,PARKSTONE RD}, was rebuilt in 1946.She has lived in the area for 60 years.In 1941 there were lots of craters in the roads caused by the bombing.In the war when trams went into the depot,the wires at the top of the trams sparked.Thats the reason people believed there was so much bombing along the road.After the war, buses replaced trams because the roads were in such bad condition.Mrs Hellier said that Coventry has changed over the last few years;Foleshill Rd, Old Church Rd.and Beresford Ave.used to be lovely areas.At the bottom of Clinton Rd.there were fields. The children used to swim in the canal. Then they built a factory.The only bother she gets from the factories is the sawing from the timber-yard.
